compounddef.title: HEX2DEC Convert Hexadecimal Numbers To Decimal

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: Converts a hexadecimal number (encoded as a string matrix) into integers. The syntax for its use is y = hex2dec(x) where x is a character matrix where each row represents an integer in hexadecimal form. The output is of type Double.

sect1.title: Examples
sect1.para: Or for a more complex example
